quest.name: Mountaintop Diplomacy
journal: Alphinaud seems convinced that the moogles hold the key to finding Hraesvelgr.

Unwilling to abandon his efforts to contact the moogles of the Churning Mists, Alphinaud resolves to seek the assistance of the furry creatures' Twelveswood kin. Travel to Gridania, and rendezvous with him at Nophica's Altar.

Upon arriving in Old Gridania, Alphinaud informs you that he has requested an audience with the Elder Seedseer. Provided you can secure Kan–E–Senna's assistance, you should have little difficulty contacting the moogles of the Twelveswood. Speak with the silent conjurer to gain access to the Lotus Stand.

After exchanging heartfelt greetings with the Elder Seedseer, Alphinaud explains the urgent nature of your visit. By good fortune, Kuplo Kopp overhears your conundrum, and pledges to accompany you back to the Churning Mists. To the surprise of all present, Kan–E–Senna then offers to do the same. Speak with Alphinaud at Nophica's Altar, and discuss arrangements for the return journey.

While Alphinaud escorts the Elder Seedseer and her entourage on the long road through Dravania, he asks that you return to Sohm Al's summit and inform your companions that help is on the way. Seek out Estinien in the deserted moogle settlement.

Thanks to the diplomacy of Kan–E–Senna─and the sight of Kuplo Kopp's familiar form─the moogles of the Churning Mists are persuaded to reveal themselves. Despite Kuplo Kopp's reassurances, however, the moogles' chieftain is not convinced that you will act in his people's best interests. Speak with Moglin, and begin the process of earning his trust.

It seems that Moglin has devised a number of trials by which he shall judge you worthy of his assistance. By the command of their chieftain, the moogles Moghan, Mogmug, and Mogwin stand ready to administer these mysterious tests...
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud at Nophica's Altar.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Confound it. Could we but enlist the aid of one of the local moogles, I am certain Hraesvelgr would not elude us for long...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Though the Eye enables me to sense the presence of dragons, I can only identify Nidhogg's with any certainty. We could wander the Mists for days, and not know if we were any closer to his brood-brother...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And those are days we cannot well afford to squander. Shall we divide our forces, then?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Lady Ysayle─might I ask you to question any dragons whom you judge it safe to approach?

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: I shall try. Yet I fear the influence of Nidhogg's rage will render most of the Dravanians in the area deaf to reason. And what of you, Master Alphinaud?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I have not yet given up on the moogles.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename─come with me to Gridania. I mean to petition the aid of the moogles' kin in the Twelveswood. After that business with Moggle Mog, I daresay they will be glad to help us.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Assuming you have no need of me, I shall remain here.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Nidhogg senses both the loss of his consort and the coming of the Eye, and his attention is firmly fixed in this direction. I mean to do what I can to hold his gaze, in the hope that it might delay any action against Ishgard.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Estinien.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Come then, Forename, let us make haste for Gridania, and rendezvous at Nophica's Altar. Ah, but I neglected to tell you...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There is an aetheryte of ancient construction here which should make the return journey rather less arduous. Pray do not forget to use it!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I sincerely hope you have taken Master Alphinaud's advice concerning the aetheryte. You would not wish to miss the sport if Nidhogg deigned to visit us in your absence.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I sent word to the Elder Seedseer upon arriving in Gridania, and I am pleased to report that she has agreed to grant us an audience. If anyone can help us to contact the Twelveswood moogles, it is she.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We are expected at the Lotus Stand. I trust you are familiar with the conjurer stationed at its entrance?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer will receive us at the Lotus Stand. I trust you are familiar with the conjurer stationed at its entrance?

dialogue.name: DOORMANLOTUS
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer awaits you. Pray follow me.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Lotus Stand?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I bid you welcome, friends. The Admiral spoke of having met with you, but 'tis no less of a relief to see you safe and hale with mine own eyes.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We humbly thank you for agreeing to receive us upon such short notice, my lady─and for all you have done for us in our absence. Would that it were solely to express our gratitude that we came to you this day...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Alas, the tides of battle yet dictate our comings and goings. Elder Seedseer─we would beg your wisdom in a matter that may finally bring an end to the Dragonsong War.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Speak on, friend.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: ...I see. So you seek a means to contact these moogles of the Churning Mists...

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-???-)Kupopopo! I say, kupo!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Greetings, Kuplo Kopp. To what do we owe the pleasure of your company?

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)I was struck by the sudden urge to bring you some fruit, Kan–E─and I'm jolly glad I did! Tell me more about these moogles in the sky, kupo!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I will gladly tell you all I know─though it amounts to precious little. We encountered a moogle high in the clouds of Dravania, and had hoped that you and your kin in the Twelveswood might agree to facilitate a meeting.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Pray correct me if I am mistaken, Kuplo, but there are legends, are there not, which speak of moogles who dwelled beyond the clouds?

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)Indeed there are, kupo! Long, long ago, back when the world was still young, they say my ancestors served the gods up in the heavens. Of course, that was before their masters took to bickering like spoiled children...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, the tale of Good King Moggle Mog XII. He is revered for holding fast to a rope of miraculous length, that his subjects might climb down from the sky and escape to the world below.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmm... Ignoring the more fanciful aspects of the tale, it may well be that Kuplo's ancestors hailed from the Churning Mists. Given how long his kin have resided in the Twelveswood, it is perfectly possible that the details of their history have faded into myth...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Indeed, Master Alphinaud. Such stories oft contain a measure of truth. 'Tis like that the moogles of the Churning Mists tell similar tales of the world below... I can well imagine why the one you encountered fled at your approach.

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)Oh, fleeing's second nature to us! We often hide when the larger races come tramping through the forest. Of course, where there's one moogle, there's bound to be more...

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)...Which is why I've decided to take a trip to the clouds, kupo! They surely won't be afraid to talk to me!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I was hoping you might say that, Master Kuplo. You will accompany us, then?

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)Just you try and stop me, kupo! I'll admit, the thought of venturing outside the Twelveswood is a bit unsettling, but I can hardly refuse a chance to meet my distant, distant cousins!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: If you will have me, I too will accompany you on this venture, and lend my voice to your cause as an ambassador of Gridania.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: M-My lady, I─ Are you quite certain?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: How oft has our nation turned to the Scions of the Seventh Dawn in its hour of need? How oft have we asked the Warrior of Light to risk herhis life to save our own?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Full many times, I say to you─and never have they refused us. Thus do I choose this day to offer mine aid to our allies for the good of the realm.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: ...Is this not just?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A most unexpected─and most welcome─offer, Elder Seedseer. We would be honored by your presence.

dialogue.name: DOORMANLOTUS
dialogue.text: Is it true that the Elder Seedseer means to journey with you to Dravania? I shudder to think of the dangers...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Pray return to the summit and inform our companions of these developments─I will serve as the Elder Seedseer's guide on the journey back to Sohm Al.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It being a path I have already trodden, I do not anticipate any great difficulties. Besides, we shall have the Elder Seedseer's personal guard to escort us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Pray return to the summit and inform our companions of these developments─I will serve as the Elder Seedseer's guide on the journey back to Sohm Al.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It being a path I have already trodden, I do not anticipate any great difficulties. Besides, we shall have the Elder Seedseer's personal guard to escort us.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, you are returned. How fared you in Gridania? Better than I, I hope... Hraesvelgr's whereabouts yet elude me.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Well met, Warrior of Light. Nidhogg has not stirred, but he watches us, unblinking...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: ...Hm? The Elder Seedseer herself answers your call? Then there is naught to do but wait.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: They are here, Forename.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Greetings, my friends. I am happy to report that our journey was mercifully uneventful, devoid as the road was of Dravanians. 'Twould seem the dragons have abandoned Sohm Al for the Churning Mists.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Elder Seedseer, may I present to you Ser Estinien, Ishgard's Azure Dragoon.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: 'Tis an honor to meet you, Ser Estinien. I have heard many tales of your order's extraordinary skill and courage.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Friends─I feel it only right to inform you that we are not alone. The moogles are all around us even as we speak. And I should imagine they are more than a little concerned by the horde of strangers that have descended upon their home. Mayhap now would be an opportune moment to introduce ourselves.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: This should serve...

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)They're hiding, of course─but there are so many of them, kupo!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I am Kan–E–Senna. My companions and I have braved the long road from the Twelveswood to share words with you.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: On this, the occasion of our first meeting, we bring an offering of light and wind.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Oooh, such a gentle and pleasing glow, kupo...

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: I am Moglin, the chieftain of this moogle clan.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Chieftain Moglin─it is an honor to meet you.

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)Greetings! I am Kuplo Kopp, ambassador of the Twelveswood moogles!

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: ...A moogle from the world below? Your hide is of a different hue, but that pom is unmistakable! I might need a moment here, kupo...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: My companions were no less surprised to learn of your existence here amongst the clouds. I hope they did not startle you overmuch in their eagerness to make your acquaintance. Full well can I imagine your wariness. I am told that men have not walked here in nigh on a thousand winters.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Mayhap you will forgive them their forwardness when I unfold to you the grave matter which first brought them into your midst. My companions crave an audience with the great wyrm Hraesvelgr that they might negotiate an end to the war 'twixt man and dragon.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: An end to war, you say? Hmm... I trust you, Kan–E–Senna─the light of peace shines brightly within your soul.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: ...But I'm afraid the same cannot be said of your friends. To be plain, we did not hide ourselves because they were the first of your kind to be seen here in a thousand years─well, not only because of that. We hid because we smelled dragon blood.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: These skies are home to many, many dragons.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: While some crave peace, such as Hraesvelgr, many others crave the opposite...such as Nidhogg. Suffice it to say, we are worried that the presence of your blood-spattered warrior friends will attract the attention of the nastier kind, and invite destruction into our happy home.

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)Now just a moment, Chieftain! Forename here may have doled out the odd thrashing or two, but it's always been for a really good reason!

dialogue.name: KUPLOKOPP
dialogue.text: (-Kuplo Kopp-)SheHe is a champion of the Twelveswood moogles, and I'll not hear herhis good name slandered!

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: Now, now, Ambassador─let's not ruffle each other's fur. I shall of course take your testimony into consideration...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: If I may, Chieftain: there is little room for trust 'twixt strangers. Might we not take this opportunity to learn more of each other?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: An excellent suggestion, kupo. In the interests of fostering friendship─and keeping an eye on you─I extend to you the hospitality of Moghome.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Prove yourselves worthy of our assistance, and it will be yours. I shall be watching, kupo!

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename, but mine efforts have all been in vain. As I feared, Nidhogg's rage drives his minions to attack me on sight.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: And the few who did deign to speak fell silent at the name of Hraesvelgr. Wherefore, I cannot say, yet I fear it bodes ill.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: Tell me─in the world down below, do all of your kind look so different from one another? It must be terribly disconcerting...

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: What was it Kuplo Kopp called you again?

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: "Forename“? Hmph! Your names are as odd as your appearance. Have you ever considered a nice moogle name? ”Moglin“ is taken, by the way, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: As are “Moghan,” “Mogmug,” and “Mogwin”─these being the names of the three wise moogles who will administer the momentous challenges that I have devised to measure your worth. I call them...the Trials of Trustworthiness.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: Undertake these trials, and we shall soon see whether or not you are worthy of our aid!

dialogue.name: MOGC01622
dialogue.text: Has Maestro Mogwin finished his latest piece? I can hardly wait to see it, kupo!
